In addition to the acknowledgment of instruments in the manner and form otherwise authorized under this subtitle, a person serving in or with the armed forces of the United States and the person's spouse or dependents may acknowledge an instrument:
wherever located; and
before any commissioned officer in active service of the armed forces of the United States with the rank of:
second lieutenant or higher in the Army, Air Force, or Marine Corps; or
ensign or higher in the Navy or United States Coast Guard.
The instrument may not be rendered invalid by the failure to state in the instrument the place of execution or acknowledgment.
